## Evaluating the models with data - create function

def metric_table(test, predictions):
    
  mse = mean_squared_error(test, predictions)
  model_r2, model_RMSE, model_MAE, model_MSE, model_MAPE, model_Adj_R2 = [], [], [], [], [], []


  r2 = r2_score(test, predictions)
  rmse = np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(test, predictions))
  mae = mean_absolute_error(test, predictions)
  mse = mean_squared_error(test, predictions)
#   mape = mean_absolute_percentage_error(test, predictions)

  # adj_r2 = 1-(1-r2)*(n-1)/(n-p-1)       # n - broj uzoraka, p - broj nezavis var
  adj_r2 = 1-(1-r2)*(test.shape[0]-1)/(test.shape[0]-1-1)

  model_r2.append(r2)
  model_RMSE.append(rmse)
  model_MAE.append(mae)
  model_MSE.append(mse)
#   model_MAPE.append(mape)
  model_Adj_R2.append(adj_r2)


  df_result = pd.DataFrame({"R2":model_r2, "Adj_R2": model_Adj_R2, "RMSE": model_RMSE, "MAE":model_MAE, "MSE": model_MSE})  #, "MAPE": model_MAPE})
  df_result = round(df_result,3)
  df_result = df_result.sort_values("R2", ascending=False)
  df_result
  return df_result
#### Import dataset
# set test set

dataset = pd.read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marko2212/test_data/main/DMD_dataset.csv', header=0, parse_dates=[0], dayfirst=True)

# df.index = df.iloc[:, 0]   
df = df[df['DATUM'].dt.weekday != 6]         # removing sunday (6) from dummy df_date
df = df.reset_index(drop=True)
# df = features
df

test_date = dataset.iloc[-n:, 0:1]
train

data = train
predict =[]
for t in test:
    model = ARIMA(data, order=(5,1,1))
    model_fit = model.fit()
    y = model_fit.forecast()
    print(y[0][0])
    # print(y)                # for now model.ARIMA
    predict.append(y[0][0])
    # predict.append(y)         # for now model.ARIMA
    data = np.append(data, t)
    data = pd.Series(data)

import pandas as pd

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

## Regression

y = dataset.iloc[:, -1].values

# Select all types of numerical data

d[['day']]

y

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size = 0.25, random_state = 0)
X_train

from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
sc = StandardScaler()
X_train = sc.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test = sc.transform(X_test)

# Evaluating the models with data using this function

model_r2, model_RMSE, model_MAE, model_MSE = [], [], [], []

def evaluate(model):
    model.fit(X_train,y_train)
    y_pred=model.predict(X_test) 
    
    # printing the model name and scores
    r2 = r2_score(y_test, y_pred)
    rmse = np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred))
    mae = mean_absolute_error(y_test, y_pred)
    mse = mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred)
    print("Model name:------->    ",model)
    print("R2   score:------->",round(r2,2))
    print('RMSE score:------->',round(rmse,2))
    print('MAE  score:------->',round(mae,2))
    print('MSE  score:------->',round(mse,2))
    print("<<<<-------------------------------------------------------------------->>>>")
    model_r2.append(r2)
    model_RMSE.append(rmse)
    model_MAE.append(mae)
    model_MSE.append(mse)

# Initialize the models
lir = LinearRegression()                                                                      # linear regression
pr = LinearRegression()                                                                       # polynomial regression
logr = LogisticRegression()
dtr = DecisionTreeRegressor(random_state = 0)                                                 # decision tree regression
rfr = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators = 100, random_state = 0)                             # random forest regression
svr = SVR(kernel = 'rbf')                                                                     # support vector regression
rr = Ridge(alpha=1.0)                                                                         # ridge regression
lsr = Lasso(alpha=2.0, max_iter = 10000)                                                      # lasso regression
knn = neighbors.KNeighborsRegressor()                                                         # KNeighbors regression
xgb = XGBRegressor()                                                                          # XGBRegressor
# xgb = XGBRegressor(n_estimators=1000, max_depth=7, eta=0.1, subsample=0.7, colsample_bytree=0.8)
# xgb = XGBClassifier(learning_rate=0.1,n_estimators=500,random_state=42)

poly_reg = PolynomialFeatures(degree = 4)
X_poly = poly_reg.fit_transform(X_train)

models=[lir, pr,logr,  dtr, rfr, svr, rr, lsr, knn, xgb] #create a list of models
model_names = ['Linear Regression', 'Polynomial Regression','Logistic Regression', 'Decision Tree Regressoion', 'Random Forest Regression',
               'Support Vector Regression', 'Ridge regression', 'Lasso regression', 'KNeighbors regression', 'XGB Regression']


for model in models:
    evaluate(model)

# sort models by r2
df_result = pd.DataFrame({"R2":model_r2, "RMSE": model_RMSE, "MAE":model_MAE, "MSE": model_MSE, "ML Models": model_names})
df_result = round(df_result,3)
df_result = df_result.sort_values("R2", ascending=False)
df_result.style\
    .background_gradient("Blues",  subset=['R2'])\
    .background_gradient("Blues_r",  subset=['RMSE', 'MAE', 'MSE'])

from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
regressor = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators = 100, random_state = 0)
regressor.fit(X_train, y_train)

y_pred = rfr.predict(X_test)
np.set_printoptions(precision=2)

df_result = pd.DataFrame({"predicted":np.round(y_pred), "real": y_test, "diff": abs(np.round(y_pred) - y_test)})
df_result['diff%'] = df_result['diff'] / df_result['real']*100 
# df_result = df_result.astype(int)
# df_result

df_result

plt.figure(figsize=(8,5))
# plt.figure(figsize=(20,7))

plt.plot(y_test,  label='real')
plt.title('Real vs Predicted')

plt.legend()
plt.show()

## Import library

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from pandas.plotting import autocorrelation_plot
import matplotlib as mpl
import matplotlib.pyplot as pyplot
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

from datetime import datetime, timedelta
import time
from dateutil.parser import parse 
import math

import warnings
warnings.simplefilter("ignore")

from sklearn.metrics import r2_score, mean_squared_error, mean_absolute_error   # metrics
from statsmodels.tsa.seasonal import seasonal_decompose
from statsmodels.graphics.tsaplots import plot_pacf
from statsmodels.tsa.statespace.sarimax import SARIMAX
from statsmodels.tsa.ar_model import AutoReg
from statsmodels.tsa.arima.model import ARIMA
import pmdarima as pm

from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.model_selection import cross_val_score
from sklearn.svm import SVR
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.linear_model import Ridge
from sklearn.linear_model import Lasso
from sklearn import neighbors
from xgboost import XGBRegressor 

pyplot.rcParams.update({'figure.figsize': (10, 7), 'figure.dpi': 120})
print('lib are imported')
### Evaluating the models with data - create function

def metric_table(test, predictions):
    
  mse = mean_squared_error(test, predictions)
  model_r2, model_RMSE, model_MAE, model_MSE, model_Adj_R2 = [], [], [], [], []


  r2 = r2_score(test, predictions)
  rmse = np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(test, predictions))
  mae = mean_absolute_error(test, predictions)
  mse = mean_squared_error(test, predictions)
  # mape = mean_absolute_percentage_error(test, predictions)

  # adj_r2 = 1-(1-r2)*(n-1)/(n-p-1)       # n - broj uzoraka, p - broj nezavis var
  adj_r2 = 1-(1-r2)*(test.shape[0]-1)/(test.shape[0]-1-1)

  model_r2.append(r2)
  model_RMSE.append(rmse)
  model_MAE.append(mae)
  model_MSE.append(mse)
  # model_MAPE.append(mape)
  model_Adj_R2.append(adj_r2)


  df_result = pd.DataFrame({"R2":model_r2, "Adj_R2": model_Adj_R2, "RMSE": model_RMSE, "MAE":model_MAE, "MSE": model_MSE})
  df_result = round(df_result,3)
  df_result = df_result.sort_values("R2", ascending=False)
  df_result
  return df_result
### Create function that add all missing date

def add_all_date(df, whitout_sun=0):
  rng = pd.date_range(start = df.index[0], end =df.index[-1],  freq='D')        # pocetni datum je prvi index (datum), rajnji datum je poslednji red indexa
  df_date_temp = pd.DataFrame({ 'DATUM': rng}) 
  if whitout_sun == 1:
    df_date_temp = df_date_temp[df_date_temp['DATUM'].dt.weekday != 6]          # removing sunday (6) from dummy df_date_temp
  df_date_temp.set_index('DATUM', inplace=True)                                 # set column date as index
  df = df[df.index.weekday != 6]                                                # removing sunday (6) from df
  df = df_date_temp.join(df)                                                    # left join dataset on dummy date
  df = df.fillna(0)                                                             # fill NaN values with 0
  df = df.iloc[:,-1:].astype(int)                                               # convert string to int
  return df
### Create function that group date by week

def group_by_week(df):
  df['year_month_week'] = df.index.strftime('%Y_%m') + '_' + df.index.week.astype(str)      # create year_month_week from index
  df_week = df.groupby('year_month_week').sum()         # group df by week
  return df_week
#### Import dataset

# credentials

jdbcDatabase = "db-sql-dmd"
jdbcPort = "1433"

password = "5Avramovic!"

    "user" : username,
    "password" : password,
    "driver" : "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver"

# connect to database with credentials, execut SQL 
pushdown_query = "(SELECT DATUM, STAVKE_NA_KOMIS_NALOGU FROM src.komisionAggFinal ) Grupno"
df_spark = spark.read.jdbc(url=jdbcUrl, table=pushdown_query, properties=connectionProperties)
# display(df_spark)
df = df_spark.toPandas()                      # Spark df to Pandas df

df.set_index('DATUM', inplace=True)
df.index = pd.to_datetime(df.index)           # convert index to datetime
df
#### Test-Train Split

n = 19

df = add_all_date(df, )      # add all missing date with (df, 0) or without (df, 1) sunday
train = df.iloc[:-n]
test = df.iloc[-n:]

test.head()
### Train ARIMA model and prediction

# model = ARIMA(train, order=(p,d,q))
order = [28,1,1]
model = ARIMA(train, order=(order))
model_fit = model.fit()
prediction = model_fit.forecast(n)

if not isinstance(prediction.index[0], datetime):               # ako index nije datum pretvori ga u datum
  prediction = prediction.to_frame().set_index(test.index)      # move series to dataframe and set index as test datum

# korekcije
prediction = prediction.clip(lower=0)                           # sve negativne vrednosti svedi na 0
prediction = add_all_date(prediction)                           # set sundey to 0
prediction
### Graph

# pyplot.figure(figsize=(8, 5), dpi=80)       # adjust graph size
pyplot.figure(figsize=(20, 7), dpi=80)       # adjust graph size
pyplot.plot(prediction, color='red', label='prediction')
pyplot.plot(test, label='real')
pyplot.legend(loc="upper left")
pyplot.show()
# print(order)
metric_table(test, prediction)             # metric table
### Group by week after day prediction and plot

prediction_week = group_by_week(prediction)
test_week = group_by_week(test)
pyplot.figure(figsize=(20, 7), dpi=80)       # adjust graph size
pyplot.plot(prediction_week, color='red', label='prediction')
pyplot.plot(test_week, label='real')
pyplot.legend(loc="upper left")

round(prediction_week).to_csv('prediction_week.csv', sep=',', encoding='utf-8')        # download prediction_week
round(test_week).to_csv('test_week.csv', sep=',', encoding='utf-8')                    # download prediction_week
print(order)

## Grid search ARIMA

# grid search ARIMA parameters for time series
import warnings
from math import sqrt
from pandas import read_csv
from statsmodels.tsa.arima.model import ARIMA
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# create empty metric_grid
metric_grid = pd.DataFrame(columns=['0,0'])
metric_grid_average = pd.DataFrame(columns=['order'])

# evaluate an ARIMA model for a given order (p,d,q)
def evaluate_arima_model(X, arima_order):
	# empty metric_grid
	metric_grid = pd.DataFrame(columns=['0,0'])
	# prepare training dataset
	# train_size = int(len(X) * 0.97)
	train_size = len(X)-n
	train, test = X[0:train_size], X[train_size:]
	history = [x for x in train]
	# make predictions
	predictions = list()
	for t in range(len(test)):
		model = ARIMA(history, order=arima_order)
		model_fit = model.fit()
		yhat = model_fit.forecast()[0]
		predictions.append(yhat)
		history.append(test[t])
	# calculate out of sample error
	# rmse = sqrt(mean_squared_error(test, predictions))
	mape = mean_squared_error(test, predictions)
	return mape
 
# evaluate combinations of p, d and q values for an ARIMA model
def evaluate_models(dataset, p_values, d_values, q_values):
	dataset = dataset.astype('float32')
	best_score, best_cfg = float("inf"), None
	for p in p_values:
		for d in d_values:
			for q in q_values:
				order = (p,d,q)
				try:
					mape = evaluate_arima_model(dataset, order)
					if mape < best_score:
						best_score, best_cfg = mape, order
					print('ARIMA%s MSE=%.3f' % (order,mape))
          # fill metric_grid with mape result
					d_q = str(d) + ',' + str(q)
					metric_grid.loc[p, d_q] = round(mape,3)
				except:
					continue
	print('Best ARIMA%s MSE=%.3f' % (best_cfg, best_score))

# load dataset
n = 30
t_now = datetime.now()
series = pd.read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marko2212/test_data/main/DMD_stavke_komis_dataset.csv',index_col='DATUM', header=0, parse_dates=[0], dayfirst=True)
# evaluate parameters

p_values = [0,1, 2]
d_values = range(0, 2)
q_values = range(0, 2)

## Import library

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

import matplotlib as mpl
import matplotlib.pyplot as pyplot
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

from datetime import datetime, timedelta

import math

import warnings

from statsmodels.graphics.tsaplots import plot_pacf

print('lib are imported')
### Evaluating the models with data - create function

def metric_table(test, predictions):
    
  mse = mean_squared_error(test, predictions)
  model_r2, model_RMSE, model_MAE, model_MSE, model_Adj_R2 = [], [], [], [], []


  r2 = r2_score(test, predictions)
  rmse = np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(test, predictions))
  mae = mean_absolute_error(test, predictions)
  mse = mean_squared_error(test, predictions)
  # mape = mean_absolute_percentage_error(test, predictions)

  # adj_r2 = 1-(1-r2)*(n-1)/(n-p-1)       # n - broj uzoraka, p - broj nezavis var
  adj_r2 = 1-(1-r2)*(test.shape[0]-1)/(test.shape[0]-1-1)

  model_r2.append(r2)
  model_RMSE.append(rmse)
  model_MAE.append(mae)
  model_MSE.append(mse)
  # model_MAPE.append(mape)
  model_Adj_R2.append(adj_r2)


  df_result = pd.DataFrame({"R2":model_r2, "Adj_R2": model_Adj_R2, "RMSE": model_RMSE, "MAE":model_MAE, "MSE": model_MSE})
  df_result = round(df_result,3)
  df_result = df_result.sort_values("R2", ascending=False)
  df_result
  return df_result
### Create function that add all missing date

def add_all_date(df, whitout_sun=0):
  rng = pd.date_range(start = df.index[0], end =df.index[-1],  freq='D')        # pocetni datum je prvi index (datum), rajnji datum je poslednji red indexa
  df_date_temp = pd.DataFrame({ 'DATUM': rng}) 
  if whitout_sun == 1:
    df_date_temp = df_date_temp[df_date_temp['DATUM'].dt.weekday != 6]          # removing sunday (6) from dummy df_date_temp
  df_date_temp.set_index('DATUM', inplace=True)                                 # set column date as index
  df = df[df.index.weekday != 6]                                                # removing sunday (6) from df
  df = df_date_temp.join(df)                                                    # left join dataset on dummy date
  df = df.fillna(0)                                                             # fill NaN values with 0
  df = df.iloc[:,-1:].astype(int)                                               # convert string to int
  return df

### Create arima function

def arima(df):
    n = 30
    order = [28,0,0]
    order = [3,0,0]
    model = ARIMA(df, order=(order))
    model_fit = model.fit()
    prediction = model_fit.forecast(n)

    # korekcije
    prediction = prediction.clip(lower=0)                           # sve negativne vrednosti svedi na 0
    prediction = add_all_date(prediction)                           # set sundey to 0
    prediction = prediction.rename(columns={'predicted_mean': item})        # set the name of column as item
    prediction.head()

    # ako prediction_contaier ne postoji kreiraj ga od prve predikcije, u suprotnom dodaj novu predikciju na prediction_contaier
    if 'prediction_contaier' not in globals():  
        # print('not exist')   
        global prediction_contaier          
        prediction_contaier = prediction
    else:
        # print('exist')             
        prediction_contaier =  prediction_contaier.join(prediction, how='left', lsuffix='_left', rsuffix='_right')
    return prediction_contaier
#### Create import dataset total function

def import_ds_total(item, brend, table):
    pushdown_query = "(SELECT DATUM, {0} FROM {2} ) {1}".format(item,brend,table) 
    df_spark = spark.read.jdbc(url=jdbcUrl, table=pushdown_query, properties=connectionProperties)
    df = df_spark.toPandas()                      # Spark df to Pandas df

    df.set_index('DATUM', inplace=True)           # convert DATUM column to index
    df.index = pd.to_datetime(df.index)           # convert index to datetime
    df = add_all_date(df, )                       # add all missing date with (df, 0) or without (df, 1) sunday
    df.head(2)
    return df
